sentences.english: He found the chest to contain silver coins.
sentences.chinese: 他发现那囗箱子装着银币。

sentences.english: Silver and gold coins were once in common use in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 金银币曾经是美国的流通货币。

sentences.english: That was pretty hot production and try to build inventory of blanks.
sentences.chinese: 那绝对是非常热卖的产品，也詴图建立银币坯饼存货。

sentences.english: Also the former governors used to tax forty shekels of silver a year, now I took off the fine.
sentences.chinese: 我同时还废除了原本一年40谢克尔银币的税收制度。

sentences.english: eg: He bent over and picked up a silver coin.
sentences.chinese: 他弯下腰捡起了一枚银币。

sentences.english: Room, you'd say, for a silver coin or a beetle bug.
sentences.chinese: 你会说，这是用来装银币或者甲壳虫的。

sentences.english: It is true, foreign trade had always insisted upon a certain amount of gold and silver coin.
sentences.chinese: 国外的贸易总是基于金币和银币是一个事实。

sentences.english: He took out the bronze coins from his knapsack and filled it with silver coins.
sentences.chinese: 他把铜币从背包里拿出来，把银币装了进去。

sentences.english: The silver coinage was repeatedly debased with copper vellon.
sentences.chinese: 银币一再用铜币维隆来替代，实行贬值。

sentences.english: The old man conjured up a bag of silver coins from his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 老人像变戏法似的从衣袋里掏出一包银币。

sentences.english: The goldsmith gave him three hundred talers, and remained a hundred in his debt.
sentences.chinese: 于是，金匠给了他三百个银币，还欠他一百。

sentences.english: He gave Samuel thequarter shekel of silver, but Samuel refused to take it.
sentences.chinese: 他把四分之一的银币给塞缪尔，但是他拒绝接受。

sentences.english: The second was a 20-cent coin made of silver alloy.
sentences.chinese: 第二种硬币是两角的合金银币。

sentences.english: Dimes and pennies are fractional currency.
sentences.chinese: 一角银币和分币都是辅币。

sentences.english: He is good at conjuring with silver coins.
He bent over and picked up a silver coin.

definition: flat silver (former coinage)/also written 銀圓|银圆/silver dollar
flat silver (former coinage)/also written 銀元|银元/silver dollar
copper coin of the Ming and Qing Dynasties
fractional currency (coin or note of value smaller than the country's unit of currency)/token (used instead of money for slot machines etc)
to cast (pour metal into a mold)
